Package camzup.core

Class Curve2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.EntityData
camzup.core.Curve
camzup.core.Curve2
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICurve, IEntityData, IUtils, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Knot2>
public class Curve2
extends Curve
implements java.lang.Iterable<Knot2>
Organizes a Bezier curve into a list of knots. Provides a function to retrieve a point and tangent on a curve from a step in the range [0.0, 1.0].

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Curve2.Easing
    An easing function to facilitate animation between multiple curves.

      public static Curve2 rect​(float x0i, float y0i, float x1i, float y1i, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rectangle. The first coordinate, x0 and y0, specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate, x1 and y1, specifies the bottom right corner.

      x0i - top left corner x
      y0i - top left corner y
      x1i - bottom right corner x
      y1i - bottom right corner y

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(float x0, float y0, float x1, float y1, float corner, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The first coordinate, x0 and y0, specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate, x1 and y1, specifies the bottom right corner. The fifth parameter specifies the corner rounding factor.
      Parameters:
      x0 - top left corner x
      y0 - top left corner y
      x1 - bottom right corner x
      y1 - bottom right corner y
      corner - the rounding factor
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • rect

      public static Curve2 rect​(float x0i, float y0i, float x1i, float y1i, float tl, float tr, float br, float bl, Curve2 target)
      Creates a rounded rectangle. The first coordinate, x0 and y0, specifies the top left corner; the second coordinate, x1 and y1, specifies the bottom right corner. The next four parameters specify the rounding factor for the top left, top right, bottom right and bottom left corners.
      Parameters:
      x0i - top left corner x
      y0i - top left corner y
      x1i - bottom right corner x
      y1i - bottom right corner y
      tl - rounding top left corner
      tr - rounding top right corner
      br - rounding bottom right corner
      bl - rounding bottom left corner
      target - the output curve
      Returns:
      the rounded rectangle

    • eval

      public Knot2 eval​(float step, Knot2 target)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0], returning a knot on the curve. The knot's fore handle and rear handle are mirrored.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      target - the output knot
      Returns:
      the knot

    • eval

      public Vec2 eval​(float step, Vec2 coord, Vec2 tangent)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0], returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      step - the step
      coord - the output coordinate
      tangent - the output tangent
      Returns:
      the coordinate
      See Also:
      Vec2.bezierPoint(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2), Vec2.bezierTanUnit(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, float, Vec2)

    • evalFirst

      public Vec2 evalFirst​(Vec2 coord, Vec2 tangent)
      Evaluates the first knot in the curve. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      coord - the output coordinate
      tangent - the output tangent
      Returns:
      the coordinate
      See Also:
      Vec2.subNorm(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • evalLast

      public Vec2 evalLast​(Vec2 coord, Vec2 tangent)
      Evaluates the last knot in the curve. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      coord - the output coordinate
      tangent - the output tangent
      Returns:
      the coordinate
      See Also:
      Vec2.subNorm(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • evalRange

      public Vec2[][] evalRange​(int count)
      Evaluates an array of vectors given a supplied count. The array is two-dimensional, where the first element of the minor dimension is the coordinate and the second is the tangent.
      Parameters:
      count - the count
      Returns:
      the array

      Returns:
